input_text: therapist: hi kyle how have you been ? patient: i not too good man . therapist: not too good ? patient: yeah . so something happened over this past week i wa i wa driving to my buddy house and i forgot that my tag for my car is expired earlier this month . so i got pulled over for that and then i do know why i did this but the cop asked to search my car and i wa like yeah that fine like whatever because he said he had two search . this is getting towed . and i completely forgot that i had my junk bag in the trunk . so we opened the trunk and he wa looking through the bag . so he found me he found everything . i had my weed in there at the bottom the pipe like all my piece . so i got a i got in trouble for possession . so i just i just want him to court and the judge offered me this decision . he said that i could either do two week of community service like about hour or i could pay fine . and i trying to i really trying to figure out which one really which one would be better i guess the both kind of suck but therapist: so you struggling with the decision between two option you perceived a negative right . patient: right . therapist: now we discussed the marijuana usage before wa just probably the root of this problem . right ? patient: right . therapist: but it sound like you did really want to explore change this time . patient: no i mean it it really not a problem like it just they do really want it problem is that i got caught like i doing good in school work fine . so obviously like marijuana is other than just going to court it ha never been a problem . therapist: so let focus on this decision then . patient: right therapist: so the decision is between a couple week of community service what kind of community service ? patient: just picking up crap inside of the road ? therapist: or fine ? patient: yeah . therapist: and do you have the thousand dollar ? patient: i do but i have i got a vacation coming up and i definitely like i want to i want to keep the money for like a little little vacation we like do some some fun stuff with my buddy . definitely like i want to keep that money . but i mean i also like the community service is like also kind of close to the vacation so i might have to like give up part of the vacation or to to do the two week so that i think that did really help my decision either . therapist: do you see any value in either one of these option which is all become negative ? patient: i mean really like they both they both have the same negative i guess like like if i if i do the community service that i like you know i do get to keep the money . but i mean other hand like if i keep the money i doing community service like i not gon na have all the time to spend the money . so it now i mean neither really have a positive and both the negative are kind of equal to so it it kind of tough to choose . therapist: so let talk about what important to try to help you make this decision . really what you going to have to determine is and what i want to explore is the importance of keeping the money . right because that really what this come down to . patient: right . therapist: you you keep it and you do the service or you spend it and you do do the service ? patient: right therapist: so you could you could say that it about the importance of keeping the money rr you could say it about the importance of avoiding the community service . patient: right . therapist: so let talk a little about that . what how would you say on a scale of one to where is very important . how would you scale keeping the money ? patient: i mean that obviously pretty high . like i guess keeping the money it be like a nine . because if i like if i if i keep the money obviously i can like use it for other other thing . i say probably nine . therapist: so keeping in mind that that very important to you . patient: right . therapist: so that scenario would be would lean more toward completing the community service . patient: right . yeah i mean i guess that true . like i did think about it in that way like if i if i give up the the two week of time like obviously that would suck but like i have i guess i have more of a choice of what to do with money compared to my time . you know so i guess i could think about it that way maybe therapist: well let look at the other side too . how important is it for you on a scale of one to to avoid the community service ? so we know it a nine right to keep the money ? patient: right . therapist: how to avoid the community service ? patient: maybe like i guess maybe about a seven because the like the community service i mean it would be that bad . obviously like it would be a waste of time . we gon na have to do this crap work for for so long but i do know . like at least i know if i do the community service and it would be like done after this amount of time . you know so i can i can always keep that in mind . therapist: so a you talking it seems like you leaning toward or maybe you leaning toward completing the service . even though you not happy with either choice right ? patient: right therapist: that might be the least objectionable . patient: yeah yeah . yeah i guess cuz i never like i never thought about scaling it like that way . so yeah i think so . therapist: when do you have to make this decision by ? patient: by the end of the week so today tuesday so i have like a couple of day to think it over . therapist: and you go back before the judge on friday patient: on friday yeah . when i get the decision . therapist: once you weigh some of the factor with the way this importance of the money versus doing the community service patient: right therapist: let meet again just before maybe on thursday . okay let meet again thursday . and just talk about it and take a look at your decision making process and making sure that you made a decision that you can be most happy with . i know neither option is happy option for you . patient: right therapist: they one that the least destructive for you the least negative for you patient: right therapist: that sound like a plan . ? patient: all right . yeah i think i can do that . yeah give me some more . therapist: good then i see there . patient: yep sound good . therapist: take care .

patient had a problem in the past week . patient got pulled over by a cop for expired tag . cop searched the car and found weed . patient went under possession the sent to the court and charged a fine or community service of hour . patient wa confused between selecting either of the option . therapist got to know that marijuana is the root of this problem . patient wa doing school work fine so patient thought that marijuana is just a thing that made to go to court . therapist asked to patient choose either of the option between a fine or community service of hr . therapist asked to scale both option from to . patient wa planning for a vacation but patient wa ready give week for community service . then the patient scaled money out and community service out of . therapist asked to take a decision by the end of the week and choose the right option for you .

therapist: okay marsha so how can i help you today ? patient: well i working full time . i part time student . i just gotten engaged and i live at home . there just so much stress in my life everything happening all at once . just to top it all off i failed an exam a really big exam . and i just feel like i ca do anything anymore . i ca do anything right . i just got so much stress and i feel like such a disappointment such a failure and embarrass my family by failing . yeah i just do know what to do anymore . and i guess i come here today to tell you like oh i want to leave uni i guess that why coming to you today . therapist: okay so it sound like a whole lot of stuff on top of you patient: yeah that so much just piling on me therapist: so you working full time part time study and then you got your wedding preparation . patient: yeah just got engaged and wedding just a month away now . so yeah so just got so much happening . work is really demanding . yeah i just found this exam . it just yeah . all too much . therapist: so imagin you been sweating on this for a while and it all been swirling around in your head patient: just been building up and so much pressure with everything and i living at home so my parent you know a lot of pressure need to do everything right . and and by failing this i feel like i just embarrassed them and disappointed them and i just do feel like i good enough to go on studying . therapist: okay . and have they said much to you about filing exam ? patient: they have said much . i wa really scared to tell them actually because i knew they just be so disappointed and disinterest by the fact that i did fail . yeah i never failed anything before . and so yes . really hard . therapist: yeah . so it new and you do like it at all ? patient: not at all . i think leaving uni will just be the way out just so i do have to go through it again . therapist: okay well i glad you come to counseling because it good for u to get an outsider opinion when we got so much on our plate and we confused a to what to do and our emotion can get in the way . and you just said earlier that a whole lot of stuff on your plate at the moment . okay . so i glad you come here . here with the clinic we use the abc model which is a cognitive behavioral therapy model . so marsha some counselor have put together a list of belief that we often use . and we do realize that we using those belief and they tend to be faulty one . here the least here . have a look through that to see if there are any belief that you might be operating on at the moment . patient: i think number two therapist: okay . read that one out for me patient: that it necessary to have a high degree of uncertainty in order to be happy and perform well . therapist: yeah . you mentioned that patient: number that it necessary to be competent and successful in all those thing which are attempted . therapist: hmm yeah that an expectation from your family . patient: yeah . possibly number eight . that loss should be entirely pleasant ending and enjoyable that any frustration discomfortable pain would be unbearable . therapist: hmm . yeah . which one of those stand out the most for you at the moment ? patient: umm probabily number . yeah . therapist: how would you put that in your own word ? patient: that i need to be successful all the time andeverything that i do . therapist: hmm . patient: yeah . therapist: and is that different from what happening in your life at the moment ? patient: well failing that exam i mean i wa successful with that . so yeah it just throw out i guess even number two because throw that all the order in my life . i need to have everything . i need to know what i doing where i going . yes . therapist: okay so if number four is an expectation that your family ha given that you have of yourself how do you measure up next to number four ? patient: i do feel like i good enough . therapist: okay . all right . well what i like to do is is put some of those idea on the board under the abc . and i explain a we go along . patient: okay . therapist: okay . so what do you think the trigger point might be or the activating event for you at the moment ? patient: i mean there are a lot of thing but i think obviously filing the exam wa the main one . therapist: all right . and and the consequence you thinking of leaving uni . and and that statement you made earlier about ? yeah that that the one . that the crucial one and i explain it shortly when i get up to the board . patient: okay . therapist: okay i think i put it up there now for you so we can work through that . so marsha the activating event which is what you stated earlier and the kind of decision that you thinking about is patient: leaving uni ? therapist: that right okay . so it important that we consider the jump from here over to here . and the kind of thinking that you been swirling around in your head affect the consequence . and you mentioned earlier that number four seems to fit . and you put that in your own word . what are your word before ? patient: that i not good enough . therapist: it really important for u to consider that kind of thinking hmm . okay marsha it good that we got those thing on the board . and what i like to do now is focus stepping out a bit from your situation and looking looking at it from another point of view . to me it sound like you you doing a whole lot of thing really well . can you list all of the thing that you doing really well ? patient: i working it a really demanding job you know keeping up with it . i guess . thing that my fiance i mean we engaged . so planning the wedding that going really well . it stressful but it going well . therapist: and all of you other university subject ? patient: yeah . never sold anything before . this is the first time i guess all the other subject ? yeah yeah . therapist: and you succeeding in all of those thing together ? patient: yeah . therapist: you juggling it . and it a lot on your plate at the moment . but it sound like you been able to cope up until this point of the one exam . patient: yeah . this one just threw me off balance . just failing . therapist: so would you describe yourself a successful most of the time ? patient: yeah most of the time therapist: yeah . and what the evidence for that ? patient: passing all my fan all the time . i just passing my subject not getting that full time job . it a great job that i doing . i getting married . therapist: yeah that right . yeah . so how do all of those success compared to that belief that you written that i written on the board for you ? patient: i guess in comparison i am good enough . therapist: yeah that right . yeah . and all the evidence is there . all of the subject that you passed in first year and now second year . year round full time job . that a success . yeah it great . yeah . good . okay . well what i like to do is get you to write that on the board to dispute that belief . okay . yeah . would you do that ? patient: alright therapist: well done last that a powerful statement . what kind of decision go along with that ? patient: staying at uni . therapist: good . okay . knock that on the board first . patient: okay therapist: alright that good . good . okay . so you made a bit of a decision have you ? patient: yeah . therapist: okay . tell me about it . doe it feel like okay ? patient: yeah . i feel like i should stay . therapist: okay . why is that ? patient: i can try again . everything doe have to be all the time . good . good . yeah i mean i could reset the exam . therapist: okay yeah . yeah . and we talked about all your success . yeah . so it hard now to believe that top statement that i not good enough . patient: yeah i mean i am good enough compared to all the thing that you helped me realize with all the success that i had that i am good enough . yeah . good . therapist: okay . and so this idea about staying at uni . patient: yeah i will stay . i am good enough . so i sure i can give it another go and see how it go from there . i can reset the exam and i sure i be fine . therapist: okay good . okay . what i like you to do is to keep saying that statement . i am good enough to say it in front of the mirror two or three time a day so that you build up your confidence because it going to take some time to reprogram you confuse it or up here with that kind of positive belief of about yourself rather than carrying around that other belief . and we tend to carry those other belief for year and year and year . and so it going to take a bit of work on your part to deliberately change your thinking and change your belief system . but you made a great start here today . so congratulation . patient: thank you

patient ha just got engaged and so much stress at home . also patient failed a critical exam which made him disappointed and stressed . patient doe know what to do and doe have any job but which he need the most . patient feel like patient embarrassed and disappointed the family and building more pressure in head . therapist understands the problem and suggests abc therapy . cognitive behavioural therapy which work on our belief . therapist asks patient to read some point which help to clarify the thought and doubt . patient think that he is not good enough to reach his family expectation . the patient want to live uni because of disappointing the family by failing an exam . therapist asks marsha to focus and considering only good thing in which patient doing well . therapist made convinced the patient is good enough to handle all the stress he had in life by his own word . therapist suggested practicing positive affirmation in front of the mirror consistently and be confident .

therapist: ha it made you rethink your entire job in the profession ? patient: yeah i mean it making me think like you know if i just had some desk job like if i just crunched number or something i would never have to have this responsibility . like why would they trust me with a job like this ? like i just a human being who you know doe know any better than any other person and i just do know if i can do this . it just so much responsible . and i guess i guess before i felt like i could handle it . and now i just feel like it so much responsibility for one person . and i do think that i can handle it anymore . but i do want to change job because i been here for so long . and i liked it before . i do know . therapist: you fearful of this happening again . patient: yes therapist: and how you may handle it ? what may happen ? patient: i feel like it just around the corner . and this is even resolved . i still afraid of the consequence of this you know like what if you know you know these kid are out of their parent home . and i just feel like what if something bad happens to them where they are now and then that going to fall on me and you know people like other my co worker know that i the one that did this . so like if something happens to the kid like i going to be the one that they going to blame for it . therapist: so just to make sure i understand your report . so they were engaging in these behavior . and your report just what precipitated the them being broken up . patient: yeah . because you know before that i guess you know probably nobody else would have known about it . so i made the report about what wa going on . and i think yeah a a direct result . therapist: alright let let take a look at the habit right . so in cbt we like to evaluate evidence and try to look at the fact a we understand them . and really we want to scrutinize and carefully review the fact and the evidence and hold a light to it and try to figure out what going on . right . what would have happened with this family if you had work no one intervened ? patient: i do know . i mean it wa going great for the kid . it wa really great environment . but i just feel like if i had left it alone i do know that the kid would be with their parent . therapist: so they all be together . and you feel like right now . he saying with them being a part . that sound good . is that fair together ? patient: yeah i mean i guess . i guess i feel like it probably wa great for them to be there . i mean that why i made the report . that my job but it just feel like you know i just feel like i playing god . you know what i mean ? like i just coming in here and spend like minute with a family and then totally turn their whole world upside down . therapist: you have a tremendous amount of power and if you misuse that power you could devastate family . that maybe what you you think happened to you ? patient: yeah . therapist: so going back to what would have happened to them let me just step back there for a moment . they would still be together without your intervention . and that could be a positive . what about consequence that maybe were negative ?
